data.name: CollectingText
data.value: You need to describe all the concerns and suggestions you have. At the next retrospective, we will discuss everything together and document the decisions. Until the retrospective begins, the cards are visible only to their author.

data.name: GroupingText
data.value: We are now at the grouping stage. Combine cards with similar ideas into logical groups. This will help simplify the discussion during the retrospective. If necessary, edit the cards so that their meaning is clear to everyone.

data.name: PrioritizingText
data.value: We are now at the prioritization stage. Review the grouped cards and vote for the ones you believe are the most important to discuss. You can distribute your votes across different cards or assign multiple votes to a single one. This will help us focus on the most meaningful topics during the retrospective.

data.name: ConfirmMoveToDiscussing
data.value: Early voting closure. Proceed to discussion?

data.name: DiscussingText
data.value: At this stage, team members sequentially discuss the cards that were created and supported during voting. The goal is to gain a deeper understanding of each card, identify issues, share perspectives, and suggest solutions.

data.name: SlotDropText
data.value: Drag here to change the type

data.name: ItemRemoveConfirm
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the card?

data.name: ConfirmGiveFacilitator
data.value: Are you sure you want to become a facilitator?

data.name: RetroAssessmentQuestion
data.value: Was the retro worth our time?

data.name: AssessmentSuccess
data.value: Thank you for sharing your opinion

data.name: ColumnStartDescription
data.value: Add notes about things that would have a positive impact on the team that aren't already implemented.

data.name: ColumnStopDescription
data.value: Add notes about things within your team's workflow or process that aren't helping the team to achieve their goals and should be stopped.

data.name: ColumnContinueDescription
data.value: Add notes about things that worked well in the previous iteration and should stay in the workflow.

data.name: ColumnToDiscussDescription
data.value: Tasks, questions, or topics that haven’t been addressed yet. Waiting to be reviewed at an upcoming meeting or during a conversation.

data.name: ColumnDiscussingDescription
data.value: Topics currently being discussed. Team members are exchanging opinions, seeking solutions, or clarifying details.

data.name: ColumnDiscussedDescription
data.value: Topics that have already been reviewed. Decisions have been made, and no further discussion is needed.

data.name: RetroTypeHidden
data.value: The item text is hidden from participants

data.name: RetroTypeClosed
data.value: The presence of items is hidden from participants

data.name: RetroTypeOpened
data.value: The item text is visible to all participants

data.name: BacklogText
data.value: This section contains items that were brought up in previous retrospectives but haven’t been implemented yet. It’s a good opportunity to revisit ideas that are still relevant and follow through on them. Review the list, pick what still matters, and add it to the work plan.

data.name: ActionsHint
data.value: Write a specific action with an owner and a deadline — not an idea, but a step.

data.name: ActionItemStageNewHint
data.value: Action item from retro — clear, doable, with owner and deadline.

data.name: CanNotStartRetro
data.value: To start the retro, you need to register at least one card

data.name: VoteByItemCountField
data.value: Maximum number of votes per item
